values.alignmentText: Berlin's thriving .NET market spans enterprises and startups; visa routes and remote roles fit Trey as he improves his German.

Great inland lake beaches near Berlin (Strandbad Wannsee, Müggelsee, Havel) with sandy shores and family facilities; water quality monitored; easy access by S-Bahn or car.

Berliners largely respect personal space; in crowded U-Bahn you may be pressed together, but touch is avoided and you should ask before touching a child.
Berlin has two to three strong seasons with mild springs and falls. Winters are cold, so outdoor time shifts to late spring to early fall.
Berlin sits in Germany's federal parliamentary system with coalitions and a strong rule of law. It offers stable governance and open civic channels.

Berlin Kita offers universal care from age 1 with subsidies; central districts face high demand, so early registration and bilingual options help your kids.
Berlin private schools offer English curricula (BCS/JFK), but tuition is steep; privates are a premium backup while good bilingual public options exist.
Berlin offers strong access to fresh foods via markets and supermarkets. Processed snacks are common, but mindful planning keeps meals balanced for a family.
Total comp trails top markets ~25–30% in Berlin; grants, EU Blue Card visas, healthcare, and strong family support offset the gap for Trey and Sarah.

values.key: View of Them by Neighboring Countries
values.alignmentText: Neighbors see Berlin as stable, globally connected, and family-friendly, with universal healthcare and strong schools, though visa processes can be slow.

Berlin winter range is -2 to 5 °C; reliable transit and services keep commutes smooth, aligning with the family's mild, low-disruption winter preference.
Berlin's tech weeks average 37-38h with regulated overtime and leave. This supports the family's slower pace and remote/hybrid work options.
